result.markdown:
---
title: "One-Way ANOVA"
author: "James Van Slyke"
---




## One-Way ANOVA Example

Practice dataset: How does preschool affect language development?

Three groups that differ by how many hours they spent in preschool per week

*Variables*

-   IV = Preschool

-   DV = Language Development

Language development was measured based on a language development test score

Null Hypothesis: Attendance at preschool has no effect on language development

### View Dataset


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
View(ch15ds1)
```
:::


View in R Console


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ch15ds1
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
      Group Language.Score
1   5 Hours             87
2   5 Hours             86
3   5 Hours             76
4   5 Hours             56
5   5 Hours             78
6   5 Hours             98
7   5 Hours             77
8   5 Hours             66
9   5 Hours             75
10  5 Hours             67
11 10 Hours             87
12 10 Hours             85
13 10 Hours             99
14 10 Hours             85
15 10 Hours             79
16 10 Hours             81
17 10 Hours             82
18 10 Hours             78
19 10 Hours             85
20 10 Hours             91
21 20 Hours             89
22 20 Hours             91
23 20 Hours             96
24 20 Hours             87
25 20 Hours             89
26 20 Hours             90
27 20 Hours             89
28 20 Hours             96
29 20 Hours             96
30 20 Hours             93
```
:::
:::


### Bar Graph of the Data

Step 1 - create table of Descriptive Statistics


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dplyr)
Preschool_Descriptives <- ch15ds1 %>%
  group_by(Group) %>%
  summarize(n = n(),
            mean = mean(Language.Score),
            sd = sd(Language.Score),
            se = sd / sqrt(n),
            ci = qt(0.975, df = n - 1) * sd / sqrt(n))
```
:::


Check it out


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
Preschool_Descriptives
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 3 Ã— 6
  Group        n  mean    sd    se    ci
  <chr>    <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
1 10 Hours    10  85.2  6.20  1.96  4.43
2 20 Hours    10  91.6  3.41  1.08  2.44
3 5 Hours     10  76.6 12.0   3.78  8.56
```
:::
:::


Now graph it based on the descriptive statistics


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(Preschool_Descriptives, 
       aes(x = Group, 
           y = mean)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=mean-ci,
                    ymax=mean+ci))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](One-Way-ANOVA_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Run the ANOVA

First install Psych package


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(psych)
```
:::


Check out the variables.

Psych package uses a different command for this "describeBy"

Must specify DV and groups


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
describeBy(ch15ds1$Language.Score, group = ch15ds1$Group)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

 Descriptive statistics by group 
group: 10 Hours
   vars  n mean  sd median trimmed  mad min max range skew kurtosis   se
X1    1 10 85.2 6.2     85   84.38 5.19  78  99    21 0.89    -0.15 1.96
------------------------------------------------------------ 
group: 20 Hours
   vars  n mean   sd median trimmed  mad min max range skew kurtosis   se
X1    1 10 91.6 3.41   90.5   91.62 2.97  87  96     9 0.26    -1.72 1.08
------------------------------------------------------------ 
group: 5 Hours
   vars  n mean    sd median trimmed   mad min max range skew kurtosis   se
X1    1 10 76.6 11.96   76.5    76.5 14.08  56  98    42 0.05     -0.9 3.78
```
:::
:::


Run your ANOVA! Something new, must save results in an object rather than the results being there automatically.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
m1 <- aov(Language.Score~Group, data = ch15ds1)
```
:::


### ANOVA Table

To get ANOVA table must use "summary" function


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value  Pr(>F)   
Group        2   1133   566.5   8.799 0.00114 **
Residuals   27   1738    64.4                   
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::
:::


### Effect Size

Figure out the effect size - Eta squared The formula is SSbetween/SSTotal or SSbetween/SSbetween+SSResidual


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
1133/(1133+1738)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.394636
```
:::
:::


### Conclusion

Write out conclusion

> Number of hours in Preschool had a significant effect on language development, F(2, 27) = 8.799, p = 0.00114, ðœ‚2 = 0.39.

Where is the difference? Need to use post hoc tests

### TukeyHSD

TukeyHSD will tell us where the differences are between the individual groups.

Run TukeyHSD on saved ANOVA results


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
TukeyHSD(m1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
  Tukey multiple comparisons of means
    95% family-wise confidence level

Fit: aov(formula = Language.Score ~ Group, data = ch15ds1)

$Group
                   diff        lwr        upr     p adj
20 Hours-10 Hours   6.4  -2.497288 15.2972884 0.1941234
5 Hours-10 Hours   -8.6 -17.497288  0.2972884 0.0596448
5 Hours-20 Hours  -15.0 -23.897288 -6.1027116 0.0007780
```
:::
:::


Finally, write out the whole conclusion.

> TukeyHSD post hoc tests revealed that 20 hours a week of preschool (M=91.6, SE=1.96) resulted in significantly higher levels of language development in comparison to 5 hours (M=76.6, SE=3.78). This difference, -15 95% CI\[-23.90, -6.10\] was significant with an adjusted p = .0008.

### Improving the graph


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(Preschool_Descriptives, 
       aes(x = Group, 
           y = mean)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=mean-ci,
                    ymax=mean+ci)) +
  scale_x_discrete(limits=c("5 Hours", "10 Hours", "20 Hours"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](One-Way-ANOVA_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


Make it look real nice Clark


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(Preschool_Descriptives, 
       aes(x = Group,
           y = mean)) +
  theme_minimal() +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill="steelblue") +
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=mean-ci,
                    ymax=mean+ci), width=.3, size=1) +
  labs(title = "Does Preschool Effect Language Development?", 
       y="Mean Score on Language Test", x="Number of Hours Spent in Preschool") +
  scale_x_discrete(limits=c("5 Hours", "10 Hours", "20 Hours"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](One-Way-ANOVA_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
